174.article_body: On being asked if he would 'mankad' the batter, LSG all-rounder Marcus Stoinis said he won't do it unless the player is "properly cheating" at the non-strikers end. He added, "I'd probably tell him off first and ask him to stay in the crease." Stoinis has scored 73 runs and taken one wicket in five IPL 2022 matches so far.

175.title: Owaisi breaks down during speech, says 'Muslims are being wiped out'
175.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Friday broke down while addressing a gathering in Hyderabad and alleged that "Muslims are being wiped out of the country". Speaking on the bulldozer row, Owaisi said that he gets calls every day about the "instances of injustice" happening in India. "One shouldn't lose hope...We'll face it with patience but will never raze...home," he added.

176.title: Statehood demand for North Bengal justified: BJP MLA amid heatwave
176.article_body: Condemning West Bengal government's decision to announce early summer vacations in schools due to heatwave, BJP MLA Sankar Ghosh said the demand for separate statehood for North Bengal was "justified". He called North Bengal's weather "moderately pleasant". The "step-motherly" treatment of the TMC government towards North Bengal has led to this demand, he added.

177.title: Curfew imposed in Punjab's Patiala till 6 am tomorrow after 2 groups clash
177.article_body: Local authorities have imposed an 11-hour curfew in Punjab's Patiala after clashes broke out between two groups during an anti-Khalistan protest by Shiv Sena on Friday. The curfew, which was imposed from 7 pm, will remain in force till 6 am on Saturday. According to Patiala SSP, four persons, including two police personnel, have sustained injuries in the incident.

178.title: India's economy may take up to 13 years to recover from COVID-19 losses: RBI
178.article_body: India is expected to overcome the losses caused by the COVID-19 disruptions by 2034-35, the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) stated in its report on currency and financing released on Friday. It further stated, "India suffered among the biggest pandemic induced losses in the world in terms of output, lives and livelihoods...Economic activity has barely recovered...even after two years."

179.title: Nobody else is bowling at 150 kmph in world right now: Steyn on SRH's Umran
179.article_body: SRH bowling coach Dale Steyn said the franchise's 22-year-old pacer Umran Malik will undoubtedly play for Team India in future as he's bowling at 150 kmph consistently in IPL 2022. "Nobody else is doing that in the world right now," he added. "I'm just trying to pat him on the shoulder and...encourage him when he bowls well," he further said.

180.title: Pregnant woman forced to drink toilet cleaner by husband in Telangana, dies
180.article_body: A pregnant woman in Telangana's Nizamabad district died on Wednesday after her husband forced her to drink toilet cleaner. The accused is on the run and police have formed teams to catch him. The woman's family members lodged a complaint against the accused and his family members alleging that they had harassed her for additional dowry.

181.title: MP-MLA couple's intent was to challenge law and order: Mumbai Police
181.article_body: Mumbai Police today opposed the bail pleas of Amravati MP Navneet Rana and her husband MLA Ravi Rana. Police claimed the couple's announcement to recite Hanuman Chalisa in front of CM Uddhav Thackeray's residence was with an intention to challenge law and order. Their acts were part of the larger conspiracy to get Maha Vikas Aghadi government dissolved, police added.

182.title: 182 COVID-19 cases reported at IIT Madras campus so far as 11 more test +ve
182.article_body: Eleven more persons have tested positive for COVID-19 at IIT Madras campus in Tamil Nadu, taking the total number of infected people to 182, state Health Secretary J Radhakrishnan informed on Friday. Radhakrishnan added that the campus hasn't been closed yet and government and campus authorities are trying to ensure that the COVID-19 cluster does not spread to other places.

183.title: 50 killed in a blast after Friday prayers at a mosque in Afghanistan
183.article_body: An explosion killed more than 50 worshippers after Friday prayers at a mosque in Afghanistan's Kabul, the head of the mosque said. The attack came as worshippers at the Sunni mosque gathered after Friday prayers for a congregation. Several mosques and cities are being targeted in Afghanistan during the Muslim holy month of Ramadan.

184.title: VHP, Bajrang Dal activists recite Hanuman Chalisa in support of temple in Agra
184.article_body: Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) and Bajrang Dal activists on Friday recited the Hanuman Chalisa at the office of the Divisional Railway Manager (DRM) of North Central Railway's Agra division in Uttar Pradesh. As per reports, the activists were opposing any move to shift the Chamunda Devi temple from the platform of the Raja Ki Mandi railway station in the city.

185.title: Hindi is a link language: K'taka minister on nat'l language debate
185.article_body: Referring to Ajay Devgn and Kiccha Sudeep's exchange over the national language, Karnataka minister Dr CN Ashwathnarayan said, "Hindi is nothing but a link language." He said, "We need to love our language and at the same time, respect other languages and coexist." We are here to promote the local language as it is our identity, he added.

186.title: Putin, Zelenskyy accept Indonesia's invites to attend G20 summit
186.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy have accepted Indonesia's invites to G20 summit in November, amid calls by US and its allies to remove Russia from the grouping. Indonesia, the current chair of the G20, said that the war in Ukraine has impacted the recovery of the global economy. Notably, Ukraine is not a G20 member.

187.title: I’m not a major fan of it in all honesty: Russell on F1 sprint races
187.article_body: Mercedes' George Russell said he is "not a major fan" of F1 sprint races after the first sprint race of the season at the Emilia Romagna Grand Prix. There are three sprint races scheduled for this season, with a push by several teams to double that to six sprint races. Russell added sprint races should "probably be 50% longer".

188.title: BJP wants to create disturbance over louspeaker issue: Sanjay Raut
188.article_body:
Accusing the BJP of creating disturbance over the loudspeaker issue in Maharashtra,
Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said the BJP opposed an all-party meet called by the state government to discuss the issue. "[This] means you (BJP) want to do politics and want to create a disturbance on the matter of loudspeakers in [Maharashtra]," Sanjay Raut said.

189.title: Man Utd interim boss Rangnick appointed as Austria head coach
189.article_body: Manchester United on Friday said interim boss Ralf Rangnick has been appointed as the head coach of the Austrian national football team. United said Rangnick will join the national team at the end of May after the 2021-22 Premier League season ends. The club added Rangnick, 63, "will combine the job with his consultancy role at Old Trafford as planned."

190.title: Thousands take part in anti-Israel rallies on Jerusalem Day in Iran
190.article_body: Thousands of Iranians on Friday took part in rallies in Iran to mark the "Quds Day" (Jerusalem Day) for the first time since the coronavirus pandemic began. The day, being marked since 1979, is a way of showing support for the Palestinians. The demonstrators chanted "Death to Israel" and "Death to America" at the rally.

191.title: I think it should be Sanskrit: Kangana Ranaut on national language debate
191.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut, while speaking on the national language debate, said, "If you ask me which language should be the national language, then I think it should be Sanskrit." "Sanskrit is older than Kannada, Tamil, Gujarati or Hindi. All these languages have come from Sanskrit. Then why hasn't Sanskrit become the national language?" she added.

192.title: 56-yr-old Odisha MLA appears for Class 10 board exam, says 'it was my wish'
192.article_body: BJD MLA from Odisha's Phulbani, Angada Kanhar, appeared for his Class 10 state board examination on Friday, at the age of 56. "I couldn't appear for the examination when I had to, due to various family issues...It was my wish to appear for the examination," he said. Kanhar appeared for the examination at a school along with 67 other students.

193.title: Ex-Tennis champion Boris Becker jailed for 2.5yrs for hiding assets after bankruptcy in UK
193.article_body: Former Wimbledon champion Boris Becker has been jailed for 2.5 years in the UK for hiding £2.5 million worth of assets and loans to avoid paying debts after being made bankrupt in June 2017. The 54-year-old was found guilty of four charges under the Insolvency Act and was cleared on 20 counts, the UK media reported.

194.title: Zerodha CEO's fake Insta ID used to scam user, he shares screenshot
194.article_body: Zerodha CEO and co-founder Nithin Kamath recently warned people of various types of frauds he has encountered and used his fake account as an example. He shared a screenshot of the fake Instagram page trying to scam a user with a "crypto scheme" promising to generate $10,000 in a week. "Phishing frauds' [number] has gone through the roof," he said.

195.title: Sakariya executed his plan perfectly to dismiss Finch: DC bowling coach
195.article_body: Praising Chetan Sakariya, who made his debut for DC against KKR in IPL 2022, DC bowling coach James Hopes said the pacer didn't miss a beat and executed his plan to perfection to dismiss Aaron Finch. The KKR opener was clean bowled in Sakariya's first over of the match after scoring a seven-ball three. He posted bowling figures of 3-0-17-1.

196.title: It doesn’t make sense: Belarus’ Victoria Azarenka on Wimbledon ban
196.article_body: Belarus' Victoria Azarenka said Wimbledon's decision to ban Russian and Belarusian players from participating "doesn't make sense". The All England Lawn Tennis Club made the decision following Russia's invasion of Ukraine, which has been termed as "discriminatory" by the ATP and the WTA. "I think there should be a reaction to that, that's all I want to say," Azarenka said.

197.title: US arrests British Virgin Islands Premier on drug trafficking charges
197.article_body: The US has arrested British Virgin Islands (BVI) Premier Andrew Fahie on charges related to drug trafficking and money laundering. Fahie agreed to allow a trafficker, an undercover agent, to use BVI ports to ship cocaine to the US in return for money, a statement said. BVI Governor John Rankin said, "I realise this will be shocking news for people."

198.title: List of Indian cities with highest maximum temperature today released
198.article_body: The IMD has released a list of cities that recorded more than 44°C as their maximum temperature on Friday. UP's Banda with 47.4°C recorded the highest maximum temperature, followed by 46.8°C in Prayagraj. Rajasthan's Ganganagar and Maharashtra's Chandrapur recorded maximum temperature of 46.4°C, while UP's Jhansi and Delhi's Sports Complex observatory recorded 46.2°C maximum temperature.

199.title: Man climbs atop mobile tower in Punjab, demands release of Sikh prisoners
199.article_body: A Sikh man climbed atop a mobile tower in Rode village of Punjab's Moga district on Friday, demanding justice for Sikhs across the country. His demands included the release of Sikh prisoners from jails across the country, justice in cases of sacrilege of the Sri Guru Granth Sahib and shifting of Khalistani extremist Jagtar Singh Hawara from Delhi's Tihar jail.

200.title: Make sure to conserve maximum energy: Du Plessis on playing in heat in IPL
200.article_body: Speaking about playing amid heat wave in Maharashtra in ongoing IPL 2022, RCB captain Faf du Plessis said he takes lots of fluids before the match, adding it's important to manage the intensity while practising. He added that one has to make sure to conserve maximum energy in hot conditions. RCB will face GT in an afternoon match on Saturday.

201.title: $170 billion wiped off Amazon's market value in its biggest drop since 2014
201.article_body: Shares of Amazon fell as much as 12% on Friday in its biggest intraday percentage drop since July 2014, wiping off about $170 billion from the company's market valuation. The company's shares declined after it reported a loss of $3.8 billion for Q1 2022, marking its first quarterly loss since 2015. Amazon also posted the slowest sales growth since 2001.

202.title: Won't let anyone create disturbance in Punjab: CM Mann on Patiala clashes
202.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Friday termed the incident of clashes in Patiala as "deeply unfortunate". CM Mann said, "We're closely monitoring the situation and will not let anyone create disturbance in the [state]. Punjab's peace and harmony [are] of utmost importance." Reportedly, stones were hurled and swords were brandished after clashes broke out between two groups in Patiala today.

203.title: SII's Covovax approved for COVID-19 vaccination of kids aged 12-17: Reports
203.article_body: Serum Institute of India's Covovax COVID-19 vaccine has been recommended for vaccination of children in the 12-17 years age group by NTAGI, multiple reports said on Friday. The vaccine was granted approval for restricted emergency use among adults on December 28, 2021 and among children aged 12-17 years, on March 9. SII had requested its inclusion in the vaccination drive.

204.title: Man arrested with foreign currency worth ₹59 lakh at Delhi's IGI Airport
204.article_body: The Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) on Friday seized foreign currency worth approximately ₹59 lakh from a passenger at Delhi's IGI Airport. Officials said $22,000 and 2,00,000 UAE Dirham were found concealed under the false bottom of the bag of the passenger, who was stopped based on suspicion. The man was kept under close watch through physical and electronic measures.

205.title: Trump posts for the 1st time on his Truth Social app, uses viral typo #COVFEFE
205.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump posted for the first time on his Truth Social app, months after its launch and wrote, "I'M BACK! #COVFEFE." The term referred to a typing error he made in his tweet about the press while he was the President. Trump was banned from Twitter in January last year after Capitol riots.

206.title: Change has come but for the worse: Nawazuddin amid KGF 2, RRR's success
206.article_body: Amid the success of 'KGF: Chapter 2' and 'RRR', actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui told NDTV that after over two years of delayed films and locked theatres, his hope was that audience would emerge from the pandemic with a refined taste for cinema. "I felt the audience would mature after the pandemic...Change has come but it's for the worse," he stated.

207.title: Nandan Nilekani is India's Elon Musk for me: Snapdeal CEO
207.article_body: Snapdeal CEO Kunal Bahl said that Infosys Co-founder Nandan Nilekani is India's Elon Musk for him. "Whether it's Infosys, Aadhaar, UPI and now ONDC (Open Network for Digital Commerce), his impact on India and its global standing is nothing short of incredible," Bahl tweeted. While Nilekani's personality is distinct compared to Musk's, the quantum of his impact isn't, he added.

208.title: Sindhu reaches Badminton Asia Championships semis, confirms a medal
208.article_body: World number seven PV Sindhu assured herself of a medal at 2022 Badminton Asia Championships after entering semi-finals in Manila on Friday. Fourth-seeded Sindhu beat China's He Bing Jiao 21-9, 13-21, 21-19 in the quarter-final. Notably, Sindhu had won a bronze at the 2014 edition in Gimcheon. The 26-year-old Indian will face defending champion Japan's Akane Yamaguchi on Saturday.

209.title: LSG CEO Raghu Iyer, Gautam Gambhir's manager Gaurav Arora involved in minor road accident
209.article_body: LSG CEO Raghu Iyer, his associate Rachita Berry and franchise mentor Gautam Gambhir's manager Gaurav Arora were involved in a minor road accident today, the franchise said in a statement. The accident occurred when they were en route to the MCA Stadium in Pune for LSG's match against PBKS. "Fortunately, all three are safe and well," the franchise further stated.

210.title: Musk said he'll cut jobs at Twitter while securing bank loans for buyout: Reports
210.article_body: Elon Musk told banks he will crackdown on the salaries of Twitter executives and board members and develop new ways to monetise tweets, Reuters reported, quoting people familiar with the matter. Musk specifically mentioned job cuts as a part of his pitch to the banks to secure debt for the buyout, reports said. He took Twitter private for $44 billion.

211.title: PBKS to bowl first against LSG, Avesh Khan replaces Manish Pandey
211.article_body: PBKS captain Mayank Agarwal won the toss and elected to bowl first against LSG in their IPL 2022 clash on Friday. PBKS are fielding an unchanged playing XI, while LSG have replaced Manish Pandey with Avesh Khan. LSG are currently placed fourth on the points table, while PBKS are seventh.

212.title: Cybercriminals using Collector's photo as WhatsApp DPs: Hyd Police
212.article_body: Hyderabad Police put out an alert on Twitter asking users to stay alert as cybercriminals have been using District Collector's photo as their WhatsApp display pictures to cheat people. "Cybercriminals... (are) sending messages for financial help. Beware," Hyderabad City Police tweeted. "Do not believe such messages and do not be cheated", the police added.

213.title: Shiv Sena suspends Harish Singla after clashes during rally in Patiala
213.article_body: Shiv Sena has suspended the working president of its Punjab unit, Harish Singla, for "anti-party activities", according to an official letter issued by the party today. This comes after clashes broke out between two groups during Shiv Sena's anti-Khalistan rally in Patiala. The rally was being led by Singla and was reportedly held without a "go ahead" from the party.

214.title: Mumbai AC local trains' ticket prices cut by 50%, 5 km-journey to cost ₹30
214.article_body: Union Minister of State for Railways, Raosaheb Patil Danve, on Friday announced a 50% reduction in the ticket prices of air-conditioned local trains in Mumbai. According to him, the existing minimum fare of ₹65 for a distance of five kilometres will be reduced to ₹30. Danve further said that the fare reduction was a long-pending demand of the public.

215.title: RR to wear special jersey tomorrow to honour Shane Warne, share pics
215.article_body: RR will wear a special jersey in their IPL 2022 match against MI at the DY Patil Stadium in Mumbai tomorrow to honour late Australian spin legend Shane Warne. The players will sport initials 'SW23' on the leading collar of their shirts as a tribute to Warne. RR had won the inaugural season of IPL in 2008 under Warne's captaincy.

216.title: We're very excited that Nadal is here: Madrid Masters director Lopez
216.article_body: Madrid Masters tournament director Feliciano Lopez said everyone is excited about five-time champion Rafael Nadal playing in the tournament, beginning Sunday. "I have hopes that we can see him 100% on Wednesday," he added. The 35-year-old, who is 20-1 this season, hasn't played since losing in Indian Wells Masters final last month. He had injured his rib in semi-finals.

217.title: N Korea halts freight train services with China over COVID outbreak
217.article_body: The freight train services between China and North Korea have been suspended in response to a COVID-19 outbreak in the Chinese border city of Dandong. Local authorities have locked down 77 residential compounds in response to the outbreak that began in late April. The move comes within four months of North Korea easing the border lockdown enforced in 2020.

218.title: 22-yr-old jumps from 1st floor of Punjab showroom as 18-yr-old man tries to rape her
218.article_body: A 22-year-old woman sustained several injuries after she jumped from the first floor of a showroom in Punjab's Jamalpur allegedly after an 18-year-old man tried to rape her. "The accused found the woman alone at the shop and barged inside on the pretext of porting his mobile number," police said. The accused has been arrested.

219.title: Fuel price hike lowest under PM Modi's regime: Union minister Hardeep Puri
219.article_body: Union Petroleum Minister Hardeep Singh Puri on Friday said fuel price hike under the PM Narendra Modi-led government had been the lowest. "Basic salaries have increased over decades...The government is giving free schemes to people under various categories," he added. "The PM has advocated for the best spirit of cooperative federalism pertaining to the issue of livelihoods," the minister said.

220.title: PM Modi wears turban as he hosts Sikh delegation at his residence, pic surfaces
220.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday hosted a Sikh delegation and addressed them at his residence in Delhi. Visuals from the event showed PM Modi sporting a turban as he greeted the delegation. "Going to Gurudwaras, spending time in service, getting langar, staying at the homes of Sikh families have been a part of my life," he said.

221.title: Tamil Nadu passes resolution urging Centre to allow it to send aid to Sri Lanka
221.article_body: The Tamil Nadu Assembly on Friday unanimously passed a resolution urging the Centre to permit the state government to send essential commodities, including rice, pulses, dairy products and medicines, to Sri Lanka, amid the ongoing economic crisis. "We can't see the development in Sri Lanka as the neighbouring country's internal issue...Help should be prompt, on time," CM MK Stalin said.

222.title: MP hospital lift with patient, 6 others gets stuck for an hour
222.article_body: Seven persons, including an elderly patient on oxygen, were allegedly stuck for an hour in the lift of Shalby Hospital in Madhya Pradesh's Indore on Thursday. "We boarded the lift from...ninth floor and it got stuck on...tenth floor," a visitor said, adding, that the patient faced breathing difficulties. The hospital however claimed that the lift was opened in five minutes.

223.title: I-T official dies after SUV crashes head-on with her scooter in MP
223.article_body: A 59-year-old income tax official died after an SUV collided with her scooter head-on in MP's Bhopal on Thursday, police said. The victim, Sunita Chouhan, sustained severe head injuries after the crash and died in hospital during treatment. Police have obtained a picture of the car and are currently looking for the driver who fled after the accident.

224.title: He said 'just 1 kiss?': Another woman accuses Vijay Babu of sexual misconduct
224.article_body: After an actress accused Malayalam actor Vijay Babu of raping her, another woman has come forward to accuse him of behaving inappropriately with her in 2021. "[Vijay and I] met for a work-related thing...Suddenly he leaned to kiss me on my lips...without any consent," she alleged. "I pulled myself backwards...he then asked me 'Just one kiss?' I...said no," she added.

225.title: 18,000 kg of chicken nuggets from overturned truck closes US highway; pic surfaces
225.article_body: A highway in the US was closed for several hours this week after a tractor-trailer overturned and spilled chicken nuggets onto the road. Police say the tractor-trailer was carrying 40,000 pounds (over 18,000 kg) of frozen nuggets when the driver lost control. The driver was not injured. Crews remained on the scene for hours to clean up the chicken.

226.title: Gadkari inaugurates 12 National Highway projects worth ₹8,000 crore in Hyd
226.article_body: Union Road Transport and Highways Minister Nitin Gadkari on Friday inaugurated 12 National Highway (NH) projects worth ₹8,000 crore and seven Central Road Infrastructure Fund (CRIF) projects in Hyderabad. The NH projects, with a combined length of 460 km, will boost inter-state connectivity by enabling seamless travel from Telangana to Maharashtra, Karnataka and Andhra Pradesh.

227.title: Shah Faesal will serve same govt that imprisoned him: Omar Abdullah
227.article_body: Former J&K CM and National Conference leader Omar Abdullah on Friday congratulated former IAS officer Shah Faesal on his return to the government service. He, however, added that Faesal will now be serving the same government that imprisoned him. Faesal, who had quit the government service in 2019 citing 'rising intolerance' in India, was detained after Article 370 was abrogated.

228.title: Bengaluru police arrest 4 drug peddlers, seize ganja worth ₹1.5 lakh
228.article_body: The Central Crime Branch of Bengaluru police have arrested four Kerala-based drug peddlers, the city's Joint Commissioner of Police (Crime), Raman Gupta, said on Thursday. Police have recovered 2 kilograms of ganja, which is estimated to be worth around ₹1.5 lakh, from their possession. Further, police have also recovered four mobile phones and an electronic weighing machine from their possession.

229.title: Russian submarine strikes Ukrainian targets with cruise missiles
229.article_body: Russia's Defence Ministry has said that a Russian submarine in the Black Sea carried out missile strikes against Ukrainian military targets. The ministry also released a video of Kalibr cruise missiles being launched from the sea. Notably, this is the first time Russia has announced the use of its submarine fleet to hit Ukrainian targets, according to reports.

230.title: Lt General BS Raju appointed as new Vice Chief of Army Staff
230.article_body: Lieutenant General BS Raju has been appointed as the new Vice Chief of Army Staff. Lt General Raju is currently serving as the Director-General of Military Operations. The appointment is reportedly a rare instance of an officer who's not been an Army Commander, getting appointed as the Vice Chief. He will take charge on May 1.

231.title: I don't like watching my films as I feel I could've done better: Ajay Devgn
231.article_body: Actor Ajay Devgn said he doesn't like watching his films after a few months of release as he feels he could have done better. The actor, who recently appeared in 'RRR' and 'Gangubai Kathiawadi', said he hasn't watched either of the films. "I feel like I must have done terrible work and I don't want to watch it," Ajay added.

232.title: Papa said 'you'll find mother dead when you return': Daughters on UP BJP leader's death
232.article_body: After BJP leader Shweta Singh Gaur's dead body was found in her room in Uttar Pradesh's Banda, her daughters accused their father Deepak Singh Gaur, grandfather and other family members of murder. "Papa said that when you come back from school, you will find your mother dead...He wanted a son...They killed my mother," the daughters said.

233.title: Benedict Cumberbatch to host Ukrainian family who fled amid Russian invasion
233.article_body: Benedict Cumberbatch, in an interview with Sky News, confirmed that he's welcoming a Ukrainian family, who fled amid the Russian invasion, to his UK home. "I want to give them some stability after the turmoil that they've experienced...that's within my home," Cumberbatch said. The actor also revealed that he is helping other refugees by covering their housing costs in UK.

234.title: Australia squad for Sri Lanka series announced, Cummins rested for T20Is
234.article_body: Test captain Pat Cummins has been rested from the T20I squad from Australia's all-format tour of Sri Lanka in June and July. Marcus Harris, opener in four out of five Tests in Ashes series, was dropped from the Test squad. Spinner Adam Zampa will miss the tour as he's awaiting fatherhood. Tour comprises three T20Is, five ODIs and two Tests.

235.title: World no. 7 Ruud beats Molcan to reach BMW Open quarter-finals
235.article_body: World number seven Casper Ruud on Thursday beat Alex Molcan 3-6, 6-4, 6-4 to reach the quarter-finals of the BMW Open in Munich. "It was a very tough test. I didn't get off to a great start," Ruud said. "It gives me confidence I am able to win matches like these," he added. Ruud, 23, reached the semi-finals last year.

236.title: Cristiano Ronaldo scores to help Man Utd draw 1-1 with Chelsea in PL
236.article_body: Cristiano Ronaldo scored to help Manchester United draw 1-1 with Chelsea in the Premier League on Thursday. Ronaldo scored in the 62nd minute after Marcos Alonso gave Chelsea the lead in the 60th minute. Chelsea are currently third on the Premier League table with 66 points in 33 games. Chelsea will face Everton next in the Premier League on Sunday.

237.title: China to allow 'some' Indian students' return after India suspends Chinese visas
237.article_body: China will permit some Indian students to return for their studies, over two years after visa and flight restrictions were imposed due to COVID-19, the country's Foreign Ministry has said. "China attaches high importance to Indian students' concerns about returning," it added. This came after India suspended Chinese nationals' tourist visas, following its refusal to let Indian students return.

238.title: 64 villagers booked for killing leopard, attacking public servants in UP
238.article_body: As many as 64 people, including 10 women, were booked in connection with the killing of a three-year-old leopard by villagers in Katarniaghat Wildlife Sanctuary in Uttar Pradesh's Bahraich, police said. The incident took place after the leopard allegedly injured 13 villagers inside the sanctuary. The accused also allegedly attacked public servants and obstructed government work, the DFO said.

239.title: Pankaj remembers Irrfan on death anniversary, says 'I've only watched his films'
239.article_body: Remembering Irrfan Khan on his second death anniversary, Pankaj Tripathi said, "I get emotional every time I'm asked to talk about him." "Be it for craft, intellect, on-screen and off-screen behaviour, how to view acting, he has inspired everyone immensely," he said, adding, "When he acted, it made us take note of how he did it...I've only watched Irrfan's films."

240.title: 31-yr-old key accused in Jahangirpuri violence sent to 2-day police custody
240.article_body: A Delhi court has sent Fareed alias Neetu, one of the main accused in Jahangirpuri violence, to two-day police custody. Delhi Police Crime Branch had arrested 31-year-old Fareed from West Bengal. Police have alleged that he's "one of the conspirators" and was "seen firing at the other community" during the clashes that erupted during a Hanuman Jayanti rally in Jahangirpuri.

241.title: Assam court grants bail to Guj MLA Mevani in policewoman assault case
241.article_body: An Assam court has granted bail to Gujarat MLA Jignesh Mevani in a case of alleged assault on a policewoman. "He is likely to be released...[on Saturday]," Mevani's legal counsel Angshuman Bora said. Notably, Mevani was re-arrested in the assault case on Monday just after being granted bail in another case related to alleged objectionable tweets about PM Narendra Modi.

242.title: Shahid, Ishaan could've turned losers after my failed marriages: Mom Neliima
242.article_body: Neliima Azeem, mother of Shahid Kapoor and Ishaan Khatter, said, "My sons...[faced] a lot of challenges because, unfortunately, both my marriages failed." "I was extremely busy with (work)...I was bread earner...There were ups and downs," she said, adding, "My children shone through it all. For that, I give them an extra badge, because they...could've been losers also because of it."

243.title: If Umran remains hell bent on not reducing his pace, it won't work: Munaf
243.article_body: Ex-India pacer Munaf Patel said it "won't work" if SRH pacer Umran Malik remains "hell bent" on not reducing his pace at any cost. "You have to bowl in our conditions which are not ideal for fast bowling," added Munaf. "If he can focus more on line and length like Dale Steyn...then no one can stop him," stated Munaf.

244.title: Sidhu lauds Punjab govt as it frees 29 acres of encroached land in Mohali
244.article_body: Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu lauded the Punjab government for freeing 29 acres of encroached land in Mohali. The land had been encroached on since 2007, the Department of Rural Development and Panchayats said. "My accolades to Panchayat Minister Kuldeep Dhaliwal...This is the way forward for Punjab...seize properties of...illegal...occupants, no matter who they are," Sidhu tweeted.

245.title: Pune's Pataleshwar temple faces acute shortage of water
245.article_body: Pune's Pataleshwar cave temple is facing an acute shortage of water amid heat wave-like conditions in the city. The Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) has now requested the Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) to provide a new water supply connection to the monument. "It has become difficult to manage the daily operations with the existing supply," an ASI official said.

246.title: He promised his mom he'll take them out of poverty: Ian Bishop on DC's Rovman Powell
246.article_body: Talking about Delhi Capitals (DC) batter Rovman Powell, Ian Bishop said, "He has come from humble beginnings. He promised his mom that he will take them out of poverty when he was still in secondary school." He added, "He is living that dream to do that." Rovman was bought by DC for ₹2.8 crore in the mega auction.

247.title: Not ready to move on: Babil remembers dad Irrfan on his death anniversary
247.article_body: Actor Babil Khan on Friday penned a post remembering his late father Irrfan Khan on his second death anniversary. "I'm not ready to move on...and I'm alright with the idea that...I will never be...You still breathe, in my thoughts," Babil wrote on Instagram while sharing a picture of the late actor. Irrfan was diagnosed with neuroendocrine cancer in 2018.

248.title: Liverpool’s Mohamed Salah named England’s Men’s Footballer of the Year
248.article_body: Liverpool's Mohamed Salah on Friday was named England's Men's Footballer of the Year in the annual vote by the Football Writers' Association (FWA). Salah got 48% of the votes ahead of Manchester City's Kevin De Bruyne and West Ham United's Declan Rice. Salah, 29, has registered 30 goals and 14 assists in 44 appearances for Liverpool this season.

249.title: Man gets 8 yrs rigorous imprisonment for raping deaf-mute girl in J&K
249.article_body: A court in Jammu and Kashmir's Udhampur convicted a man of raping a deaf and mute girl and sentenced him to 8 years of rigorous imprisonment on Thursday. The convict, Karnail Singh, had barged into the girl's house six years ago and gagged and raped her, the officials said. A fine of ₹35,000 has also been imposed on him.

250.title: Zomato shares hit all-time low, wipe out half of investor wealth in 4 months
250.article_body: Shares of Zomato hit an all-time low of ₹71.15 on Friday, slipping below the lower band of IPO price in nine months since its stock market debut. Zomato has wiped out almost half of its investors' wealth since January 3, when its stock hit a high of ₹142.45. The food delivery platform's shares are down more than 15% this month.

251.title: Tibet Prez compares Nehru's policy to that after 2014, blames Nehru's faith in China
251.article_body: Central Tibetan Administration President Penpa Tsering compared Jawaharlal Nehru's policy of recognising China's sovereignty over Tibet to that in India after 2014. Tsering said Nehru had "too much faith" in China and "he did what he thought was best for India". "I think India has changed his policy by not repeating that Tibet is part of [China]," he stated.

252.title: I won't question or beg the captain for the ball: KKR's Andre Russell
252.article_body: KKR all-rounder Andre Russell said he wants to contribute more with the ball for his team in IPL 2022, but won't "question or beg" captain Shreyas Iyer for the ball. "I think everyone knows how important these last couple of games are," added Russell. Russell has picked 10 wickets in IPL 2022 so far.

253.title: Insurtech startup Turtlemint raises $120 mn, reportedly at $900 mn valuation
253.article_body: Insurtech platform Turtlemint has raised $120 million in a Series E round led by Amansa Capital, Jungle Ventures and Nexus Venture Partners. The platform has closed the current financing round reportedly at a $900-950 million valuation. The round also saw participation from new investors Vitruvian Partners and Marshall Wace, along with other existing investors.

254.title: Ajay would give 1 shot & go back to being director: Rakul on Runway 34
254.article_body: Rakul Preet Singh, speaking about 'Runway 34' co-star and director Ajay Devgn, said, "He was taking care of so many things." "From setting up, doing rehearsals, picturing every angle, every light to ensuring everything was bang on, he was more of...director," Rakul said, adding, "Then he'd just come to give one shot in a second and go back to being...director."

255.title: I'm sure Rohit, Kohli will get back in form in IPL 2022: Ganguly
255.article_body: Speaking about Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's batting performance in ongoing IPL, BCCI President Sourav Ganguly said he's sure both will get back in form in the upcoming matches. MI captain Rohit has scored 153 runs from eight matches at an average of 19.13, while ex-RCB skipper Kohli has managed 128 in nine matches, averaging 16.00, so far.

256.title: Around 8,000 British troops to take part in exercises in Europe: UK
256.article_body: Britain's Ministry of Defence on Friday said around 8,000 British Army troops will take part in exercises across eastern Europe in one of the largest deployments since the Cold War. Defence Secretary Ben Wallace said British service personnel will join with NATO allies for exercises amid Russia's ongoing invasion of Ukraine, which began on February 24.

257.title: Pakistani 'Made in China' drone shot down by BSF troops in Punjab
257.article_body: A Pakistani quadcopter was shot down by BSF troops near Dhanoe Kalan in Punjab's Amritsar on Friday. The BSF said that troops deployed at the border intercepted the drone after they heard a buzzing sound of a suspected flying object entering India from Pakistan around 1.15 am. The 'Made in China' drone was recovered after an intensive search, it added.

258.title: 2 men killed, 3 others injured in collision between 2 cars in Pune
258.article_body: Two men were killed and three others were severely injured in a collision between two cars near Pune's Kavdipath toll plaza area. According to police, the accident took place when the driver of one of the cars rammed into the other car from the side. A case has been registered against the unidentified car driver for rash driving.

259.title: Over 14,000 Bangladeshi nationals sent back since 2019: BSF report
259.article_body: Over 14,000 Bangladeshi nationals have been sent back from the Indo-Bangladesh border since 2019, a BSF report said. It said at least 9,233 Bangladeshis were held at International Border while trying to flee after their illegal stay. "At least 4,896 Bangladeshi nationals were held while trying to enter India between January 1, 2019 and April 28, 2022," BSF report added.

260.title: LIC likely to list shares on exchanges on May 17
260.article_body: The shares of Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) are likely to list on the stock exchanges on May 17. The IPO, which will be India's biggest ever, will open for subscription on May 4 and close on May 9. The government is expecting to raise ₹20,557 crore by diluting its 3.5% stake through the IPO.

261.title: CID arrests BJP's Divya Hagargi in Karnataka PSI recruitment scam
261.article_body: BJP leader Divya Hagargi was arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) in connection with the Police Sub-Inspector (PSI) recruitment scam in Karnataka. Divya was reportedly caught from a hideout in Pune in Maharashtra. She runs Jnana Jyothi Institution which is an educational institution in Kalaburagi and was the 18th accused to be arrested in the case.

262.title: Open to buying if terms are right: Petroleum Minister on importing oil
262.article_body: Union Minister for Petroleum and Natural Gas Hardeep Singh Puri said, India is open to buying oil from other countries as we've to look after our interests. "We're situated close to gulf countries like Iran which has lot of oil...We've energy relations with Russia, we buy crude from them but our total imports are not more than 0.2%," Puri added.

263.title: MP class 10, 12 board results released; 3.55 lakh class 10 students declared failed
263.article_body: The Madhya Pradesh Board of Secondary Education on Friday declared results for classes 10 and 12. The Class 10 pass percentage is 59.54% and Class 12 pass percentage is 72.72%. A total of 3,55,371 Class 10 candidates have been declared failed. The last time the pass percentage was recorded below 60% for MP Class 10 board exam was in 2017.

264.title: Naga Chaitanya to make OTT debut with Prime Video's Telugu series 'Dhootha'
264.article_body: Naga Chaitanya will make his OTT debut with Prime Video's Telugu series 'Dhootha'. The actor's first look from the series, which is a supernatural horror thriller, was shared by Amazon Prime Video on Thursday. "As [an] actor, we always crave for our work to get maximum exposure and on a platform like Prime Video, we get that exposure," Chaitanya said.

265.title: Tata aims to build 80,000 EVs this financial year: Reuters
265.article_body: Tata Motors plans to ramp up its EV production and produce nearly 80,000 EVs in the current financial year, Reuters reported. The firm built and sold 19,000 EVs in the last financial year. At present, Tata Motors reportedly accounts for 90% of EV sales in India. The firm announced plans last year to launch 10 EV models by March 2026.

266.title: Woman injured in celebratory firing in Delhi, accused son absconding
266.article_body: A 54-year-old woman sustained bullet injuries during a celebratory firing at a wedding function at Matangi Bhawan in Delhi's Chhattarpur mandir on Thursday. The accused, who is absconding, is the woman's son, police confirmed. The injured woman was unconscious and unresponsive when the police reached the hospital to take her statement, a doctor said.

267.title: Global COVID-19 cases, deaths continue to decline since end of March
267.article_body: In its weekly report, the World Health Organization said global COVID-19 cases and deaths continued to drop since the end of March 2022. WHO said during the week of April 18 through April 24, over 4.5 million cases and over 15,000 deaths were reported globally, which is a decrease of 21% and 20%, respectively when compared to the previous week.

268.title: Greater demand for Alphonso mangoes in US this year: Exporters
268.article_body: The mango exporters of India said that for the first time there is a greater demand for Alphonso mango in US this year, compared to the traditional Kesar mango. "At the start of the season, we were apprehensive and so export volumes were lower than usual. However, US consumers lapped up the mangoes which went from India," an exporter said.

269.title: Gurugram witnesses hottest April day in over 40 years at 45.6°C
269.article_body: Gurugram on Thursday witnessed its hottest day in April in over 40 years at 45.6 degrees Celsius, according to the India Meteorological Department data. Gurugram had recorded the highest maximum temperature of 44.8 degrees Celsius in the month of April in 1979. Notably, IMD has issued a heatwave alert for south Haryana districts, including Gurugram, for the next four days.

270.title: Chhavi Mittal shares pics with husband from hospital on anniversary, pens note
270.article_body: Actress Chhavi Mittal, who recently underwent a six-hour-long surgery for breast cancer, celebrated her 17th wedding anniversary with her husband, Mohit Hussein, in hospital on Friday. Sharing some pictures with Mohit, she wrote, "I would choose you 100 times over as my life partner because the way you have stuck with me through everything, I don't think anyone could've."

271.title: South Korea to lift outdoor mask mandate
271.article_body: South Korea will lift an outdoor mask mandate starting next week. Health authorities said people will still be required to wear masks at outdoor gatherings of over 50 people and sporting and cultural events with potentially large crowds. South Korea reported 50,568 new COVID-19 cases on Friday. The country had removed most of its COVID-19 restrictions earlier this month.

272.title: HC adjourns hearing of Umar Khalid's bail plea to May 6 in Delhi riots case
272.article_body: Delhi High Court on Friday adjourned Umar Khalid's bail plea hearing in connection with the 2020 Delhi riots case to May 6. "Section 124A of the Indian Penal Code is under challenge before the Supreme Court and is coming up for hearing on May 5. The findings on the 124A will have bearing on these cases as well," HC said.

273.title: Man hangs self after killing wife, 3-month-old daughter in UP's Bareilly
273.article_body: A 26-year-old man allegedly hanged himself after killing his 24-year-old wife and their three-month-old daughter in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly, police said. The incident came to light when the family members broke open the door when no one came out till late in the morning, police added. Prima facie it appears that the man died by suicide, police stated.

274.title: It was a tough start, but I was in form: Powell after win against KKR
274.article_body: Delhi Capitals batter Rovman Powell has said that he had to face a "tough start" during his match-winning knock of 33*(16) against KKR on Thursday. "Yeah, it was a tough start, but I was in form. In the early part of the season, I was going out for like one ball, two balls and those kinds of stuff," Powell said.

275.title: We see Rovman Powell as a finisher: DC skipper Rishabh Pant
275.article_body: After scoring an unbeaten 33(16) against KKR, Delhi Capitals skipper Rishabh Pant said that they consider batter Rovman Powell as a "finisher" for the franchise. "Like today when we lost too many wickets, he (Powell) had to come up and do the job. We are not thinking about the points table and taking one game at a time," Pant said.

276.title: Depp's bodyguard asked in court about seeing him urinate, actor's reaction goes viral
276.article_body: Johnny Depp burst out laughing after his bodyguard Malcolm Connolly was asked in court if he had seen the actor urinate. Connolly replied 'No' to the question. "Mr Depp had his penis out of his pants, didn't he?" he was further asked, to which Connolly replied, "I think I'd remember if I'd seen Mr Depp's penis."

277.title: After failing to make it, Army aspirant dies by suicide in Haryana
277.article_body: An Army aspirant (23) died by suicide at the premises of a government school in a village in Haryana's Bhiwani district. According to the police, the aspirant had appeared in three Army recruitment drives but failed to make it to the final cut-off. The youngster's father claimed that the deceased had even crossed the age limit for eligibility as well.

278.title: Momentum turned after Umesh started with a wicket but gave 11 runs: Shreyas
278.article_body: Discussing KKR's defeat against DC by four wickets, KKR captain Shreyas Iyer said, "[Pacer] Umesh Yadav started with a wicket but gave away 11 runs in the [first] over, that's where...the momentum turned." "You need to sit back and think where it's going wrong, can't be overconfident," added Shreyas. KKR are currently eighth on the IPL 2022 points table.

279.title: Mercedes looking at energy options should Russia cut gas delivery: CEO
279.article_body: Mercedes-Benz is looking at energy alternatives should Russia cut gas deliveries, CEO Ola Kaellenius said. "Every company is looking at options for diversifying energy sources," Kaellenius said. The automaker is working closely with German authorities to ensure energy supplies. "It is still too early to say exactly which scenario will happen," Kaellenius added.

280.title: Everything about it was wrong: Ponting on DC-RR no-ball controversy
280.article_body: Talking about the no-ball controversy during DC-RR match, DC head coach Ricky Ponting said, "Everything about it was wrong." He added, "The umpiring was wrong but you have to get on with it. For our players to remonstrate like they did and to have our assistant coach run out on the field, is not anything that we are happy with."

281.title: Yuvraj Singh trolls Shubman Gill over his 'Call Gujarat Titans for entertainment' post
281.article_body: Ex-India all-rounder Yuvraj Singh trolled Gujarat Titans (GT) opener Shubman Gill over his 'Call Gujarat Titans for entertainment' post. Gill shared pictures from GT's match against SRH, which GT won by scoring 25 runs in the last over. Referring to Gill getting out for 22(24) in the match, Yuvraj wrote, "Very entertaining your shot was," and shared a slipper emoji.

282.title: Power plants getting regular coal supplies: NTPC on Delhi govt's claim
282.article_body: The National Thermal Power Corporation Limited (NTPC) has responded to Delhi government's claims that only a day or two's stock is left at the Dadri-II and Unchahar power plants. "All six units of Dadri and five units of Unchahar are running at full capacity and receiving regular coal supplies. Present stock is 1,40,000 MT and 95,000 MT respectively," said NTPC.

283.title: Fire breaks out at jewellery office in Pune; no casualties reported
283.article_body: A fire broke out at an office of gold and silver jewellery work in Raviwar Peth in Pune in the early hours of Friday. A fire officer said that the situation was brought under control in a "quick time", adding that the cause of the fire was not ascertained. No casualties were reported and nobody was injured in the incident.

284.title: Chopping, changing opening pairs not ideal: Southee on KKR's loss vs DC
284.article_body: Talking about KKR's opening combinations following their four-wicket loss against DC in IPL 2022, KKR pacer Tim Southee said that "chopping and changing" isn't ideal but it happens when the team isn't winning a lot of matches. Both openers Aaron Finch(3) and Venkatesh Iyer(6) were dismissed by DC pacer Chetan Sakariya. KKR have six losses from nine matches so far.

285.title: Bajrang Dal, VHP hold meeting with senior MNS leaders in Pune
285.article_body: Right-wing groups Bajrang Dal and Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) held a meeting with senior leaders of Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) in Pune on Friday. This comes amid a controversy over loudspeakers in religious places. An MNS leader said both the groups have agreed to participate in the 'maha arti' on May 3, which will take place across Maharashtra.

286.title: Bride shot dead by man she was in relationship with at her wedding in UP
286.article_body: A bride was shot dead allegedly by her "jilted" lover at her wedding in Mathura's Mubarikpur village in Uttar Pradesh on Friday, police said. The accused had reportedly been in a relationship with the victim. "After 'Jai Mala', my daughter went to the room for refreshing up...an unknown person came in her room...shot her dead," the victim's father said.

287.title: Wreck of boat missing after accident that killed 14 found in Japan
287.article_body: The hull of a tour boat that went missing after an accident killed at least 14 people has been found underwater off the northern coast, said Japan's coast guard on Friday. The "Kazu I" went missing last Saturday off the island of Hokkaido with 26 people on board. Officials said 14 were found dead while the rest remain unaccounted for.

288.title: 7 arrested for throwing objectionable items outside mosques in UP's Ayodhya
288.article_body: Seven persons have been arrested for allegedly throwing objectionable items, including torn pages of holy books and inflammatory posters, outside three mosques and a shrine in Uttar Pradesh's Ayodhya, police said. It was an attempt to create communal violence and incite riots in the city, police added. Eleven persons were involved in the conspiracy and four of them are absconding.

289.title: Germany’s Scholz praises Japan for its aid to Ukraine during visit
289.article_body: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz praised Japan during a visit to the country for its support for Ukraine amid Russia's invasion. "From the start of Russia's war of aggression against Ukraine, Japan, as a G7 partner, has clearly and resolutely sided with Ukraine, Europe and the US," Scholz said. Japan is one of three Asian countries to impose sanctions on Russia.

290.title: BJP moves in right direction with right ideology: JP Nadda
290.article_body: Addressing a party programme in Ahmedabad, BJP's National President JP Nadda has said that BJP "is a party that moves in the right direction with the right ideology". "Anyone who wants to compete with our party will have to toil for 50-60 years. Our ideology is gaining global recognition...BJP is a party that...will take the country forward," Nadda said.

291.title: Pune reported 21 heat-related illnesses in March: Official
291.article_body: Maharashtra health department reported more than 300 cases of heat-related illness and 21 heatstroke deaths in March. According to State Surveillance Officer, Dr Pradip Awate, Pune reported 21 heat-related illnesses in the month of March. Notably, heat wave-like conditions have been prevailing over Pune as the city reported its hottest day in the season on Tuesday at 42 degrees Celsius.

292.title: Southern Command launches dedicated facility for veterans in Pune
292.article_body: The Southern Command on Thursday inaugurated a dedicated facility to address various concerns of the veterans from Pune military station. The aim of this node is to provide a single point access to the veterans, an official statement said. "It's a state-of-the-art complex with tailor-made workstations...to expeditiously provide information of various benefits and entitlements," it added.

293.title: Mumbai AC local train fare to be reduced by 50%: Union Minister Danve
293.article_body: The fare of AC local trains in Mumbai will be reduced by up to 50 percent, Union Minister Raosaheb Patil Danve said. He further informed that no changes will be made to the prices at which railway passes are sold. The existing minimum fare of ₹65 for a distance of 5 km will be reduced to ₹30, Danve said.

294.title: No such instruction: Govt on reports of halting electric 2-wheeler launches
294.article_body: The government has denied reports claiming it has asked electric two-wheeler makers to halt new launches until EV fire incidents were investigated. "There is no such instruction and such reports are unfounded, misleading and far from the truth," the Ministry of Road Transport and Highways tweeted. Earlier reports said government also cautioned manufacturers who haven't reported any fire incidents.

295.title: Mechanic dies after falling from 6th floor of Gurugram building while installing AC
295.article_body: An AC mechanic allegedly died after falling off the ledge from the sixth floor of a residential building while installing an AC in Gurugram's Sector 82. Kherki Daula SHO said the 20-year-old mechanic was repairing the AC with one leg on a concrete visor outside the window, which allegedly collapsed. He was not wearing a safety belt, the SHO added.

296.title: James Corden to step down as host of 'The Late Late Show' in 2023
296.article_body: James Corden will step down as the host of 'The Late Late Show' next year. The comedian has signed a one-year renewal contract with CBS which will come to an end by summer 2023. "It's been a really hard decision to leave because I'm so immensely proud of the show," said Corden, who began hosting the show in 2015.

297.title: Nikhil Siddhartha's father passes away, actor says 'Will miss our biryani outings'
297.article_body: Nikhil Siddhartha's father Shyam Siddhartha passed away on Thursday at a hospital in Hyderabad. The actor, who works in the Telugu film industry, took to Twitter on Friday to pen a note remembering his late father. "Our RTC XRoads movie and biryani outings, travel, laughter, summers in Mumbai...will miss them all," Nikhil wrote while sharing a picture with his father.

298.title: Ecuador lifts both outdoor, indoor mask mandates
298.article_body: President Guillermo Lasso on Thursday said Ecuador will immediately remove both its outdoor and indoor mask mandates. Lasso added the decision was based on vaccination rates of 87% of the country's population aged three and older and a COVID-19 positivity rate of 5%. "It is a clear indicator that we have practically beaten COVID-19," he said.

299.title: Snake charmer held for dancing with cobra during marriage procession in Odisha
299.article_body: Odisha's Forest Department officials arrested a snake charmer, who was found dancing with a live cobra to the tune of a 'Naagin' song during a marriage procession at Karanjia area in Mayurbhanj. The forest officers reportedly recovered three live cobras from the snake charmer Ram Singh. The officers also interrogated four associates of Ram Singh who were dancing with him.

300.title: I supported Obama, but extremists have hijacked Democratic Party now: Musk
300.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk has tweeted, "I strongly supported Obama for President, but today's Democratic Party has been hijacked by extremists." Earlier, he shared a diagram showing himself once being closer to moderate liberals on the centre-left but moving closer to conservatives on the centre-right as years progressed. The diagram also showed liberals moving to extreme left thinking.

301.title: T'gana Transport Minister lays foundation stone for nursing college in Hyd
301.article_body: Telangana Transport Minister, Ajay Kumar Puvvada, on Thursday laid the foundation stone for a nursing college at TSRTC Hospital in Hyderabad. The college will have 50 seats out of which five will be allotted to children of TSRTC employees, the minister said. He also inaugurated a 20-bedded ICU and an oxygen plant among other facilities at the hospital.

302.title: Fossil of largest raptor dinosaur discovered in Argentina
302.article_body: The fossil of the largest raptor dinosaur has been discovered in Argentina's Patagonia. The new species, named Maip macrothorax, was between nine and 10 metres long. It inhibited the southern tip of Argentina 70 million years ago. These megaraptors had an agile skeleton, a long tail and neck, an elongated skull with more than 60 small teeth and sharp-ended limbs.

303.title: Anti-human trafficking police rescues 10 minors, 4 women in J'khand
303.article_body: Ten minors and four women were rescued by the Railway Protection Force's (RPF) Anti-Human Trafficking Unit in Jharkhand's West Singhbhum, an RPF officer said on Friday. The victims, who were about to board a train to Kerala's Ernakulam, were detained when they failed to give a satisfactory reply, the officer added. Some of the victims' Aadhaar cards were forged.

304.title: He knew what he was doing: Singapore on executing mentally challenged Indian-origin man
304.article_body: After 34-year-old mentally challenged Indian-origin Malaysian man, Nagaenthran Dharmalingam, was executed in a drug trafficking case in Singapore, the country's drug enforcement agency defended the execution saying Dharmalingam "knew what he was doing". It added that his actions showed he was "capable of manipulation and evasion" and he did not suffer from intellectual disability.

305.title: It's been a fresh start for us: Palak on equation with father Raja
305.article_body: Actress Palak Tiwari, daughter of Shweta Tiwari and her ex-husband Raja Chaudhary, spoke about her equation with her father and said that he's sober now and they're building their bond "from scratch". "People expect us to go back to being the perfect father-daughter duo, that's not how it works," she added. "It's been a fresh start for us," said Palak.

306.title: Will take strict action: Women commission chief on B'luru acid attack
306.article_body: After a woman was attacked with acid by a man in Bengaluru, Karnataka State Commission for Women Chairperson Pramila Naidu said that strict action would be taken against the culprit. According to police, the accused man, who had been following the woman for years, attacked her after she refused to marry him. Police have launched a hunt to nab him.

307.title: Coolest thing I've seen in a while: Mahindra on video of man driving customised vehicle
307.article_body: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra tweeted a video of a man driving a customised vehicle resembling an F1 car on an Indian road and carrying dairy products in it. "I'm not sure his vehicle meets road regulations, but I hope his passion for wheels remains unregulated," wrote Mahindra. "This is the coolest thing I've seen in...a long while," he added.

308.title: Ex-IAS officer Faesal reinstated 3 yrs after quitting, says 'idealism let me down'
308.article_body: Former IAS officer Shah Faesal, who had quit the service in 2019 citing 'rising intolerance' in India, has been allowed to rejoin by the government. The 2009 batch UPSC topper had an eight-month-long stint in politics and was detained after Article 370 was abrogated. Referring to the period, Faesal said, "I lost almost everything...I'd built...My idealism had let me down."

309.title: Stones pelted, swords brandished during anti-Khalistan protest in Punjab's Patiala
309.article_body: Violence broke out between Shiv Sena and pro-Khalistani Sikh organisations on Friday over the former's anti-Khalistan protest near Shri Kali Devi Temple in Punjab's Patiala. Police personnel reportedly had to open fire and use tear gas shells to maintain law and order. In a video footage, pro-Khalistani groups were purportedly seen brandishing swords and pelting stones at Shiv Sena workers.

310.title: You almost broke my leg in my early 20s: AB de Villiers to Shoaib Akhtar
310.article_body: Recalling a match between South Africa and Pakistan, ex-South Africa captain AB de Villiers told ex-Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar on Twitter, "You almost broke my leg...in my early twenties after I decided to pull you for a six." "The minute it hit my bat I knew it was a big mistake," De Villiers wrote.

311.title: Zuckerberg's wealth increases by $11 billion in his biggest one-day gain ever
311.article_body: Meta Platforms' 37-year-old CEO Mark Zuckerberg added $11 billion to his fortune in the biggest one-day gain he has ever had, Bloomberg reported. His personal wealth surged as Meta shares soared 17.6% on Thursday after it reported that Facebook added more users than expected in first quarter of 2022. Zuckerberg is now the world's 12th-richest person with $75.9 billion wealth.

312.title: Tharoor pens poem on Kejriwal's sitting posture during meeting with PM Modi
312.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor has penned a poem on Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal's sitting posture during a virtual meeting with PM Narendra Modi. "There once was a CM of Delhi, who stretched from his head to his belly. The onscreen reticulation, revealed his pandiculation. So BJP frothed & quivered like jelly!" Tharoor wrote. BJP Delhi had called Kejriwal "mannerless CM".

313.title: Umran's first ball to Hardik was absolute fire, he was stunned: Swann
313.article_body: Ex-England cricketer Graeme Swann said SRH pacer Umran Malik's first delivery to GT captain Hardik Pandya in SRH's loss against GT was "absolute fire" and "stunned" Hardik. "Umran then bowled a rapid short delivery...got Hardik out," added Swann. Discussing the T20 World Cup 2022, Swann stated, "I will take Umran to Australia. Jasprit Bumrah's quick but...[not] express like Umran."

314.title: Activision Blizzard shareholders approve $68.7 bn Microsoft deal
314.article_body: Call of Duty-maker Activision Blizzard's shareholders have approved Microsoft's $68.7 billion proposal to buy the firm. Over 98% of the shares voted at a special meeting were in favour of the proposed transaction. Microsoft announced in January that it had agreed to acquire Activision Blizzard in its biggest acquisition to date. Microsoft's $26.2 billion LinkedIn acquisition is its second-biggest.

315.title: Rickshaw driver held for abetting suicide of live-in partner in Maharashtra
315.article_body: A 32-year-old rickshaw driver was arrested on Friday for allegedly abetting the suicide of his 28-year-old live-in partner in Maharashtra's Bhiwandi, police said. The woman had parted ways with her husband due to domestic issues and had been living with the rickshaw driver for two years, police added. The woman allegedly hanged herself due to frequent harassment, police stated.

316.title: I have stolen one of the things that Nadal did on clay: Naomi Osaka
316.article_body: Talking about Rafael Nadal, ex-world number one Naomi Osaka said she has stolen one of the things that Nadal did when playing matches on clay courts, adding that it will either go really well or very badly. "I know that every kid growing up playing tennis in the world has pretended to be Nadal at least once," stated Osaka.

317.title: Heat wave warning issued for 15 states/UTs over 5 days, IMD releases list
317.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued heat wave warning for 15 states/UTs over five days. The states/UTs are: Rajasthan, Maharashtra, Madhya Pradesh, Punjab, Haryana, Delhi, Chandigarh, Uttar Pradesh, Telangana, Jharkhand, Bihar, Odisha, West Bengal, Chhattisgarh and Gujarat. On Thursday, the IMD had issued orange alert for Rajasthan, Delhi, Haryana, Uttar Pradesh and Odisha.

318.title: PM Modi inaugurates Semicon India 2022 conference in Bengaluru
318.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Friday inaugurated Semicon India 2022 conference in Bengaluru, saying, "Semiconductors are playing a critical role in the world in more ways than we can imagine." The conference is being organised by India Semiconductor Mission. "It's our collective aim to establish India as one of the key partners in the global semiconductors supply chain," PM Modi added.

319.title: Drugs worth ₹4.50 crore seized in Assam's Morigaon, 3 arrested
319.article_body: Three people were arrested after Assam Police seized a huge quantity of drugs worth around ₹4.50 crore from their possession in Morigaon district. The accused have been identified as Basir Khan, Altaf Khan and Jahidul Ali. "We have apprehended three persons and seized two trucks and a pick-up van. The seized trucks were coming from Manipur," police said.

320.title: Taapsee Pannu-starrer 'Shabaash Mithu' to release on July 15
320.article_body: Taapsee Pannu on Friday took to Instagram to announce the release date of her upcoming film 'Shabaash Mithu'. The film, helmed by Srijit Mukherji, will release on July 15. "There is nothing more powerful than a girl with a dream and a plan to realise it!" wrote Taapsee, who essays the role of Indian cricketer Mithali Raj in the film.

321.title: I am nobody to decide role of Rahul Gandhi in Cong: Prashant Kishor
321.article_body: Prashant Kishor rejected reports which claimed that he suggested the name of Priyanka Gandhi to lead the Congress party and said that there was "no discussion" of Rahul or Priyanka in his meeting with party leaders. Kishor further said that he was nobody to decide the role of Rahul Gandhi in Congress. Kishor had recently declined offer to join Congress.

322.title: Video shows duo attacking 26-yr-old with a sword in Kalyan; booked
322.article_body: Police have booked two youths, identified as Nagesh Dalvi and Sandeep Rathore, after a video of them attacking 26-year-old Ajay Shirath with a sword at Kalyan's Mhasoba Chowk went viral on social media. Infuriated over an old dispute, the accused reportedly abused and attacked Shirath while he was crossing the street with a friend. He sustained injuries and was hospitalised.

323.title: US reports its 1st human H5 bird flu case
323.article_body: The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) has confirmed that the first known human case of H5 bird flu in the US has been confirmed in a prison inmate in Colorado. The person was involved in the culling of poultry presumed to have had H5N1 bird flu, the CDC said. The man experienced only fatigue.

324.title: Neetu Kapoor breaks down remembering Rishi Kapoor on reality show
324.article_body: Neetu Kapoor broke down in an episode of the reality show 'Dance Deewane Juniors' after a contestant's grandmother sang the song 'Lambi Judaai' while remembering late actor Rishi Kapoor. The actress, who's a judge on the show, said, "Rishi ji is not here but...every day, someone reminds me of him. Somehow, somewhere, he is still connected to me."

325.title: Amazon reports its first quarterly loss since 2015, loses $3.8 billion
325.article_body: E-commerce giant Amazon reported its first quarterly loss since 2015. Amazon's net loss for the first quarter of 2022 was $3.8 billion. "It...includes a pre-tax valuation loss of $7.6 billion included in non-operating expense from our common stock investment in Rivian Automotive," Amazon said. "Pandemic and subsequent war in Ukraine...brought unusual growth and challenges," CEO Andy Jassy stated.

326.title: Controversial slogans come up on walls of BHU campus; removed
326.article_body: Controversial slogans that had come up on the walls of Banaras Hindu University (BHU) campus in Uttar Pradesh's Varanasi were removed on Thursday by the proctorial board's security and police personnel. The slogans were attributed to a BHU student organisation. However, the student organisation denied any involvement and termed it to be a "conspiracy" by anti-social elements to defame it.

327.title: When mom doesn't like my film, she says 'hatao, ye kya banaya hai?': Aamir
327.article_body: Aamir Khan in a recent interview spoke about how his mother responds when she doesn't like his films. "When she doesn't like something, she says 'Hatao, ye kya banaya hai?' (Put it away, what have you made)," he said. Speaking about his mother's reaction to the test screening of 'Laal Singh Chaddha', Aamir said she liked the film a lot.

328.title: Following Musk's life is like taking notes while drinking from fire hose: Biographer
328.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk's biographer Walter Isaacson has said dealing with Musk's life is "like trying to take notes while drinking from a fire hose. It keeps coming fast". He added everybody wants to talk about Musk and "everybody's got thoughts about him". "I don't think he's as random as he allows himself to appear," Isaacson said.

329.title: Telangana govt and Google sign pact for skill training of youth, women
329.article_body: Telangana government on Thursday signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) with Google to provide skill training to the youth and women of the state. Under the agreement, Google will collaborate with state government to provide Google Career Certificate Scholarships to the youth. Further, Google will also start a "WomenWill" programme to train women in business and financial skills.

330.title: Mumbai-based lecturer duped of ₹80,000 while booking heli service
330.article_body: A Mumbai-based college assistant lecturer was duped of ₹80,000 by a cyber fraudster when the former was trying to book a helicopter ride from Sirsi (Karnataka) to Kedarnath (Uttarakhand). The 53-year-old complainant, who goes on Kedarnath Yatra every year, alleged that he was duped while booking the service for a group of 17 people, including him, through a website.

331.title: 5 policemen injured after scuffle with VHP members in Noida
331.article_body: At least five policemen were injured after a scuffle broke out between them and Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) members outside Noida's Sector 39 Police Station. "A group of people from VHP came...to get a person, who has been accused of rape, released," an official said. "An argument ensued and it turned into a scuffle," the official added.

332.title: Groom's family halts wedding over ladoos in Chhattisgarh
332.article_body: Upset over not serving ladoos, the groom's family allegedly halted a wedding in Chhattisgarh's Mungeli district. The groom's side reportedly objected to ladoos not being served during the wedding, which led to a brawl between them and the bride's side. When the matter reached the police station, cops intervened to settle the dispute, following which the marriage was solemnised.

333.title: Apple's Q2 revenue rises 9% y-o-y to record $97.3 billion
333.article_body: Apple announced that it has posted a March quarter revenue record of $97.3 billion, up 9% year-over-year. Its total profit was $25 billion up from over $23 billion recorded in the same period last year. Its iPad sales revenue fell 2% to $7.65 billion due to supply-chain constraints, while revenue from Mac computers rose 14.7% to $10.4 billion.

334.title: Chhattisgarh CM flags off 61 new vehicles to check crimes on highways
334.article_body: Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel flagged off 61 new patrolling vehicles to prevent human trafficking and other crimes on the highways. Tweeting pictures from the event on Thursday, Baghel informed that out of the total vehicles, 15 will be dedicated for highway patrolling, 24 for anti-human trafficking and 22 for maintaining law and order in the state.

335.title: I feel embarrassed on the pitch, it's too painful: Man Utd’s De Gea
335.article_body: Manchester United goalkeeper David De Gea said he feels "embarrassed" and "horrible" while playing for United. "When you are...3-0 or 4-0 down, it is too painful," added De Gea. "It is tough, I have been here for many years," stated De Gea. Manchester United are currently sixth on the Premier League points table and trail fourth-placed Arsenal by five points.

336.title: Bus conductor killed as 3 buses catch fire in Punjab's Bathinda
336.article_body: A bus conductor was killed after three buses caught fire on Thursday night at Bhagta Bhai Ka town in Punjab's Bathinda, police said. The conductor was sleeping in one of the buses when the incident occurred at the bus stand, police added. "There were three employees of a private transport company guarding their two buses," police further said.

337.title: Which states/UTs are on the brink of power outage amid heatwave?
337.article_body: India is witnessing the worst electricity shortage in over six years amid the heatwave. Several states/UTs are on the brink of power outage due to the increased demand of coal. They include Delhi, Haryana, Uttar Pradesh, Andhra Pradesh, Bihar, Rajasthan, Kerala and Punjab. The electricity demand shot up by 40% in Punjab, while in Rajasthan, it has increased by 31%.

338.title: Hundreds of passenger trains cancelled for movement of coal amid power crisis
338.article_body: Hundreds of passenger trains have been cancelled for movement of coal carriages amid power crisis in India. Several parts of India are facing long hours of blackouts, while some industries are cutting output due to the fossil fuel's shortage. The measure is temporary and passenger services will be restored as soon as the situation normalises, an Indian Railways official said.

339.title: Ammonia leaks from H'yana factory; breathing difficulties reported
339.article_body: Workers at a factory in Haryana's Jhajjar were evacuated and water was sprayed after the factory reported an ammonia gas leak on Thursday night. Some residents in the area complained of difficulty in breathing and vomiting, while the condition of two firefighters reportedly also deteriorated during the relief work. Meanwhile, the Additional Deputy Commissioner advised people to wear masks.

340.title: Violence doesn’t benefit anybody: Mohan Bhagwat on communal violence incidents
340.article_body: Speaking about the communal clashes which erupted in some states during Ram Navami and Hanuman Jayanti, RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat said that violence does not benefit anybody. "The society to which violence is dear is now counting its last days...For this, it is essential to bring together all communities...We all need to do this work on a priority," Bhagwat said.

341.title: Illegal arms dealer held in Kolkata, 2 country-made pistols recovered
341.article_body: The Special Task Force of Kolkata Police arrested an illegal arms dealer from city's Parsi Bagan lane area on Thursday. The police also recovered two country-made improvised firearms along with other items. The accused, identified as Ajijur Momin, is a resident of Malda. He will be produced before the court on Friday.

342.title: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp extends contract until 2026
342.article_body: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp has signed a contract extension until 2026 with his previous deal due to expire in 2024. "There is a freshness about us as a club...and this energises me," said Klopp. Ex-Liverpool player José Enrique had earlier tweeted that Klopp's contract extension is better than Liverpool signing forwards Kylian Mbappé and Erling Haaland at the same time.

343.title: Real tech skills lead to remarkable outcomes: Scaler
343.article_body: Scaler Academy highlights the value of real tech skills for impactful career results. It promises the right learning environment including dedicated mentorship & an industry-fit curriculum taught by experienced instructors. From achieving 126% average salary hike to being placed at top tech companies like Amazon, Microsoft, Flipkart & more, our alumni utilise skills to create impact, said Scaler.

344.title: Boman shares pic with Vicky, Anupam; fan says 'Too much talent in 1 frame'
344.article_body: Taking to Instagram, Boman Irani shared a picture of himself with Anupam Kher and Vicky Kaushal. "He's what we call 'a good lad'...A gentle soul and a lot more dear, Vicky Kaushal," he wrote. Reacting to Boman's post, a fan wrote, "Too much talent in one frame," while another said, "It'd be good to see...three of you together on screen."

345.title: Delhi-Meerut RRTS corridor to get first train next month
345.article_body: The priority section of the Regional Rapid Transit System (RRTS) will get its first train for the Delhi-Meerut route next month. The first train set will arrive from the Savli plant in Gujarat, an official said. The 17 km-long priority section, which is between Sahibabad and Duhai depot (Ghaziabad), will be made operational for public use by March next year.

346.title: 22-yr-old mentally challenged man sodomised in Ludhiana; 1 booked
346.article_body: Punjab Police booked one person after a 22-year-old mentally challenged man was allegedly sodomised in Ludhiana's Assi Kalan village. His mother told police that her son had gone for a walk on April 25 when the accused took him to bushes near canal and sexually assaulted him. He threatened him with dire consequences if he spoke to anyone, she alleged.

347.title: Mumbai-based drone manufacturer ideaForge raises ₹153 crore
347.article_body: Mumbai-based drone manufacturer ideaForge has raised around ₹153 crore in its Series B funding round led by Florintree. The round also saw participation from its existing investors such as ﻿Celesta Capital﻿, Infosys, Qualcomm and Infina, along with the Exim Bank of India. The startup claims to be having repeat contracts from the Indian Army for its SWITCH UAVs.

348.title: Hindu activists threaten 'suicide' over UP rly station temple's removal
348.article_body: Hindu right-wing activists have allegedly threatened to commit mass suicide if a 250-year-old temple is removed from the Raja Ki Mandi Railway Station's platform in Uttar Pradesh's Agra.
