This comes after Railways had issued a notice to shift the temple from the station's premises. A similar notice was also sent to a dargah and mosque at Agra Cantt Railway Station.

349.title: Chiranjeevi wasn't sure if hitting me will be accepted: Sood on playing antagonist
349.article_body: Sonu Sood has said his philanthropy work has made it difficult for people to cast him in negative roles as they are afraid that audience might not accept it. The actor, who plays an antagonist in 'Acharya', added the makers had to "rework...on a few scenes" after COVID-19. "Chiranjeevi...wasn't sure if hitting me will be accepted by people," said Sood.

350.title: I don't know what is going on in Virat Kohli's head: Ganguly on Kohli's poor form
350.article_body: Referring to Virat Kohli's poor batting form, BCCI President Sourav Ganguly said, "I don't know what is going on in Kohli's head." He added, "But I am sure he will regain his form and get some good runs. He is a great player." Kohli has scored 128 runs in nine IPL 2022 matches so far.

351.title: IndiGo becomes first airline to land aircraft using Indian navigation system 'GAGAN'
351.article_body: IndiGo has become the first airline in India to land its aircraft using the indigenous navigation system 'GAGAN'. The airline said the flight was conducted using an ATR aircraft and landed at Kishangarh airport in Rajasthan on Wednesday morning. GPS-aided geo-augmented navigation (GAGAN) has been developed jointly by Airports Authority of India (AAI) and Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO).

352.title: What action has IMD suggested amid heat wave in several parts of the country?
352.article_body: Amid intensifying heat wave in several parts of the country, IMD has suggested action for citizens. It has urged citizens to avoid heat exposure and avoid dehydration. "Drink sufficient water, even if not thirsty. Wear lightweight, light-coloured, loose, cotton clothes and cover the head by use of cloth, hat or umbrella etc," it said.

353.title: People run for their lives as US family brings unexploded shell at airport in Israel
353.article_body: A video shows people running for their lives at an airport in Israel after a US family brought an unexploded shell. The family picked up the artillery shell while in Golan Heights and decided to pack it in their luggage, according to authorities. The family was allowed to board their flight after being interrogated by security, who declared an all-clear.

354.title: Don't employ bouncers at bars, pubs in GB Nagar: Excise dept
354.article_body: The excise department met all GB Nagar based pub and bar owners and directed them not to employ bouncers at their establishments. This comes after a 30-year-old man died after he was allegedly assaulted during a brawl in a pub in Noida's Gardens Galleria mall. Excise officials said there are 83 licenses issued for pubs and bars in GB Nagar.

355.title: 97 kg heroin, other drugs worth ₹300 cr seized from house in Delhi's Shaheen Bagh
355.article_body: Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) on Thursday seized over 97 kilograms of heroin, 47 kilograms of other narcotics and ₹30 lakh cash from a house in Delhi's Shaheen Bagh, officials said. The seized drugs are worth ₹300 crore, as per reports. "The drugs...stored in travel bags, backpacks and jute sacks. We suspect...money seized was received through Hawala channels," police said.

356.title: It hurts when I see the situation of Barcelona: Ex-Barca manager Koeman
356.article_body: Ex-Barcelona manager Ronald Koeman said it "hurts" him when he sees the situation of Barcelona, adding that changing the manager doesn't always mean being able to improve. "I didn't have the club's full support. I hope [current manager] Xavi does," stated Koeman. Barcelona trail Real Madrid, who are on top of the La Liga points table by 15 points.

357.title: WB govt making special provisions for Ukraine-returned citizens: CM
357.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee has said that the government is making special provisions for all the 422 Ukraine-returned citizens from the state, including 419 students. "The Union government has shown an indifferent approach about their future," she added. "We have already employed two persons as contractual workers at the district magistrate's office," Banerjee further said.

358.title: KKR have many loopholes, death bowling has always been an issue: Jaffer
358.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer said KKR have many loopholes like their openers not doing well and spinners not being as impressive, adding that their death bowling has "always" been an issue. "KKR are relying heavily on Shreyas Iyer and Andre Russell. The other guys [should]...step up," added Jaffer. KKR recorded their fifth consecutive defeat in IPL 2022 against DC.

359.title: CNG price hiked by ₹2.20/kg in Pune in 4th hike this month
359.article_body: The price of Compressed Natural Gas (CNG) was hiked by ₹2.20/kg in Pune on Thursday for the fourth consecutive time in April, taking the CNG price to ₹77.20/kg in the city. In April, CNG price witnessed a hike from ₹62.20 to ₹68, then to ₹73. On April 19, the price again raised to ₹75, before the latest hike.

360.title: Manish Pandey hasn't looked in good rhythm since 2-3 seasons: Chawla
360.article_body: Cricketer-commentator Piyush Chawla said LSG batter Manish Pandey has "not looked" in good rhythm in IPL 2022 so far, adding that Pandey hasn't been in good rhythm since the last two to three IPL seasons. "It is a concern," added Chawla. Manish has scored 88 runs in IPL 2022 so far at a strike rate of 110.

361.title: 57-yr-old man dies during raid on video parlour in Mumbai's Mulund
361.article_body: A 57-year-old man died during a police raid on a video parlour in Mumbai's Mulund area on Thursday. According to an official, the crime branch had raided the parlour for allegedly operating illegally around 5 pm. The deceased, who was among those detained, began feeling unwell and was rushed to hospital where he was declared dead, the official added.

362.title: Hyderabad Police detains 3 men for cheating people via investment scam
362.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police on Thursday detained three men for allegedly cheating people of about ₹6 crore on the pretext of an investment fund with high-interest rates. According to police, the accused lured people by giving them 10% interest on their initial invested amount. Though people received returns in beginning, later the accused stopped responding to the victims, police added.

363.title: Wedding procession moves under shade of pandal amid heatwave in India; video viral
363.article_body: In a video being widely circulated on social media, a wedding procession is seen moving ahead under the shade of a pandal amid the heatwave in the country. The clip shared by Twitter user Devyani Kohli has more than 19,000 views so far. Reacting to the video, users commented, "We are Jugaad king," and "Amazing."

364.title: DC's Sakariya's wicket celebration goes viral, says 'It was for my late father'
364.article_body: DC pacer Chetan Sakariya's 'Black Panther' and 'Goku' celebration after taking KKR opener Aaron Finch's wicket went viral. Talking about it, Sakariya said, "It was an emotional celebration. It was for my late father. He always wanted me to clean bowl an international batter." "[The celebration] signifies me going to my father and telling him, 'I did it'," he stated.

365.title: Man sexually harasses sister, her 9-yr-old daughter in Pune; held
365.article_body: Pune's Pimpri-Chinchwad Police have arrested a 28-year-old man for allegedly sexually harassing his sister and her nine-year-old daughter. The man's mother claimed that in one incident her son pulled down her granddaughter's clothes and in another, he tugged at her hand and asked her to come to his bed after eating dinner. Both the incidents reportedly occurred in April.

366.title: Only impart Bible-based moral science lessons: B'luru school head
366.article_body: The principal of Bengaluru's Clarence High School, which is involved in the Bible row, had denied the allegation that non-Christian students are forced to learn the Bible and said that only moral science lessons based on the text are imparted. He added that parents and students actually "appreciate" the school for teaching moral values and this has invited more admissions.

367.title: Pakistan PM, ministers received with chants of 'chor-chor' in Saudi; video surfaces
367.article_body: A video shows people chanting "chor-chor" as Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif and other ministers made their way to Masjid-e-Nabawi in Medina. Sharif and his delegation had reached Saudi Arabia on Thursday for a three-day official visit. "I don't want to name the person responsible for this," Information Minister Marriyum Aurangzeb said in an apparent reference to ex-PM Imran Khan.

368.title: Musk's initial 9% Twitter stake purchase under probe in US: Report
368.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk's initial 9% Twitter stake purchase in early April is being probed by the US FTC, The Information reported. The FTC is probing if Musk complied with an antitrust reporting requirement when he bought the stake. It's focussing on whether Musk bought the stake to influence Twitter's management or if he looked to be a passive shareholder.

369.title: Moment of pride: Arvind Kejriwal praises Atishi on her UN address
369.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal congratulated AAP leader Atishi on her UN General Assembly address and called it "a very proud moment". Atishi highlighted the AAP government's governance model at the UNGA. "Many congratulations on making the whole world aware of the potential of the country including the sentiments of the people of Delhi...India now wants to move forward," Kejriwal said.

370.title: 26-year-old woman accuses Shiv Sena MP Rahul Shewale of rape
370.article_body: A 26-year-old woman on Thursday accused Shiv Sena MP Rahul Shewale of rape, police said. The woman lodged a complaint at Mumbai's Sakinaka Police Station, an official said. No FIR has been registered so far and the police were yet to start a probe into the complaint, the official added. Shewale has denied the accusation and called the complaint "conspiracy".

371.title: Himachal's Sach Pass reopens for light vehicles after 6 months
371.article_body: The Sach Pass, which connects Chamba with the remote Pangi valley in Himachal Pradesh, has been reopened for light vehicles after a gap of over six months, said Deputy Commissioner DC Rana. The snow clearance operation has been partially completed at the pass, Rana added. "The work to open the route for heavy vehicles is still underway," he said.

372.title: Committed to helping you invest as the ultra-wealthy do: dezerv.
372.article_body: Co-founders of dezerv., who have managed money for India's wealthiest families for 16+ years, believe that India has one of the greatest wealth inequalities. This defined their mission: to help working professionals invest as the ultra-wealthy do. They believe every person should have access to experts for their investments to avoid mistakes that could make them lose their hard-earned money.

373.title: Vidya to reunite with 'Shakuntala Devi' director for murder mystery 'Neeyat'
373.article_body: Actress Vidya Balan is reuniting with 'Shakuntala Devi' director Anu Menon for another film, titled 'Neeyat'. The upcoming murder mystery will also feature Ram Kapoor, Shahana Goswami, Shashank Arora, Mita Vasisht, Prajakta Koli, Neeraj Kabi and Amrita Puri. "I have loved the work of all...people working on this movie...It feels great to be working with all of them," Vidya said.

374.title: Man puts up loudspeakers at temples in UP's Saharanpur; arrested
374.article_body: A man was arrested on Thursday for allegedly putting up loudspeakers at temples in Uttar Pradesh's Saharanpur. This comes a day after the state government said that it had removed 10,900 "illegal and unauthorised" loudspeakers from religious places. The man, Vishu Kambojh alias Shanky, was identified as a member of the Hindu Yodha Parivar, the city's Superintendent of Police said.

375.title: SRH will feel the pain when he scores: Sehwag on Warner's 26-ball 42 vs KKR
375.article_body: Talking about DC opener David Warner's 42 off 26 balls in DC's win against KKR, ex-India opener Virender Sehwag said Warner's former franchise SRH will feel the "pain" whenever he scores runs. "Warner deserves credit for SRH's title victory [in 2016]," added Sehwag. Warner was picked by DC in the IPL mega auction having been earlier released by SRH.

376.title: China's Weibo publishes users' IP locations to combat 'bad behaviour'
376.article_body: China's Weibo has started publishing users' IP locations on their account pages and when they post comments, in a move to combat "bad behaviour" online. For users in China, Weibo will display their province or municipality, while for overseas users IP addresses will be shown. Several users welcomed Weibo's decision, while several others brought up anonymity issues.

377.title: No major communal violence in past 7-8 yrs: Naqvi to EU team
377.article_body: Union Minority Affairs Minister Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi who on Thursday met a European Union (EU) delegation, told Indian Express that he clarified to them that "there's been no major incident of communal violence in the past seven-eight years." He said that he did so after the delegation raised concerns over bureaucrats writing PM Narendra Modi a letter on the matter.

378.title: Mohammad Kaif names his all-time IPL XI, includes 5 Indians
378.article_body: Former India batter Mohammad Kaif has named his all-time IPL XI, which includes five Indians and six foreigners. Kaif named Chris Gayle and Rohit Sharma as openers, and MS Dhoni as the wicketkeeper-captain of the side. Other players include Virat Kohli, Suresh Raina, AB de Villiers, Andre Russell, Rashid Khan, Sunil Narine, Jasprit Bumrah and Lasith Malinga.

379.title: India reports 3,377 COVID-19 cases, 60 deaths in last 24 hours
379.article_body: India reported 3,377 COVID-19 cases and 60 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 3,303 COVID-19 cases and 39 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 17,801, while the death toll has risen to 5,23,753.

380.title: Airbnb tells employees they can work remotely forever
380.article_body: Airbnb told its 6,000 employees that they would have the option to permanently work remotely. The home-renting marketplace also told its US employees that they could move to anywhere in the country without a reduction to their compensation. Airbnb CEO Brian Chesky said that permanent flexibility will allow the company to "hire and retain the best people in the world".

381.title: Woman forced to give massage to policeman inside Bihar police station; video surfaces
381.article_body: A woman was forced to give massage to a police official inside a police station in Bihar's Saharsa district to reportedly get her son out of jail. The police official has been suspended after the video of him receiving massage went viral on social media. Sub Divisional Police Officer (SDPO), Sadar, Santosh Kumar confirmed the authenticity of the video.

382.title: BMC reduces number of COVID-19 vaccination centres due to low turnout
382.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) is shutting down COVID-19 vaccination centres (CVCs) with zero or less than 10% footfall as the civic body said that Mumbai's adult population is now fully vaccinated. The number of people eligible for booster doses is close to four lakh and these people won't turn up together at the same time, the BMC said.

383.title: Name villages after Milkha, Lata, Rafi: Delhi BJP to Kejriwal
383.article_body: Delhi Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) chief Adesh Gupta has asked Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal to rename 40 villages, including Hauz Khas and Sheikh Sarai, in the national capital on Thursday. He suggested these villages should be named after singers Lata Mangeshkar and Mohammed Rafi, shehnai maestro Bismillah Khan, sportsperson Milkha Singh and Kargil war martyr Captain Vikram Batra among others.

384.title: Demolition firm seeks time extension in Noida Supertech twin towers case
384.article_body: Edifice Engineering, the firm hired by Supertech to demolish the 40-storey Noida twin towers on May 22, has sought an extension of time, citing inputs from foreign experts engaged for the work. "The engineering firm has to comply with the agreement signed with Supertech," Noida Authority CEO Ritu Maheshwari said. "We can't allow time extensions on our own," Maheshwari added.

385.title: Aave CEO briefly suspended from Twitter after joke on being its interim CEO
385.article_body: DeFi protocol Aave's CEO Stani Kulechov's Twitter account was briefly suspended after he joked about being appointed Twitter's "interim CEO". However, less than 24 hours after the suspension, Twitter reversed its decision. After the suspension was lifted, Kulechov tweeted, "I'm back as interim CEO of Twitter." Prior to his suspension, Kulechov had thanked Elon Musk for the opportunity.

386.title: Chinchwad remains hottest area in Pune for 3rd straight day
386.article_body: Amid the ongoing heatwave-like conditions, Chinchwad (43.6°C) remained the hottest area of Pune city for the third consecutive day on Thursday, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said. Other areas which followed Chinchwad were Lavale (42.6°C), Shivajinagar and Pashan (41.8°C) and Lohegaon (41.7°C). Notably, Pune's day temperature was 3 to 5 degrees above normal, IMD's data said.

387.title: It shocked me: UN chief as 2 Russian missiles hit Ukraine during his visit
387.article_body: After two Russian missiles hit Ukraine's Kyiv during a visit by UN Secretary General Antonio Guterres, he said, "It shocked me, not because I'm here but because Kyiv is a sacred city for Ukrainians and Russians alike." Meanwhile Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said the blasts "prove that we must not drop our vigilance".

388.title: Want to make the biggest show: Rohit Shetty on 'Indian Police Force'
388.article_body: Filmmaker Rohit Shetty, speaking about his upcoming show 'Indian Police Force', said, "My only aim is to make it big. The biggest series." "We've been watching a lot of series from abroad...Nothing wrong in it but it's time something has to go from India...that's what I want to do," he added. It stars Sidharth Malhotra, Shilpa Shetty and Vivek Oberoi.

389.title: None of their players have got going: Vettori on KKR's loss vs DC
389.article_body: Reacting to KKR's defeat by four wickets against DC, ex-New Zealand captain Daniel Vettori said, "None of their players have just been able to get going." "[Opener] Aaron Finch has been unsettled," added Vettori. "KKR have more questions to answer than DC," stated former West Indies pacer Ian Bishop. KKR have now recorded their fifth consecutive defeat.

390.title: Jharkhand govt has become king of thieves: Arjun Munda
390.article_body: Union Minister Arjun Munda criticised the JMM-led Jharkhand government and said that the state government has become the "king of thieves". "What is happening in Jharkhand? Illegal mining is being done, loots, coal 'mafiagiri' is being done openly. The state government is not understanding why the public has chosen them... there's a lot of mismanagement," the former Jharkhand CM said.

391.title: Ugandan student falls to death from hostel's 6th floor in B'luru
391.article_body: A 24-year-old student from Uganda died after she fell from the sixth floor of the hostel building at Gitam University in Bengaluru's Doddaballapura. The incident reportedly occurred on Wednesday when the deceased tried to pick up clothes that'd fallen on a sheet at the building's edge. The death led to protests by students and some students also vandalised buildings.

392.title: Man molests 13-yr-old girl at Mumbai's Dadar railway station, held
392.article_body: A 32-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly molesting a 13-year-old girl at Dadar railway station in Mumbai. The incident occurred on Wednesday evening when the girl was sitting with her grandfather on a bench. The accused allegedly sat down next to the victim and started touching her inappropriately following which she raised an alarm, police said.

393.title: Bus hits 9 vehicles after brake failure in Pune; 1 dead, 7 injured
393.article_body: At least one person died and seven others were injured after a Maharashtra state transport bus rammed into nine other vehicles in Pune's Balaji Nagar on Thursday, police officials said. The incident allegedly occurred as the driver lost control due to suspected brake failure, a police inspector said. Over 20 passengers were on board the bus when the incident occurred.

394.title: 3-yr-old killed, 10 injured as vehicle falls into gorge in Chamba
394.article_body: A three-year-old boy died and nine other children were injured after a Bolero carrying them fell into a gorge in Chamba. The driver, along with three children, has been seriously injured. As per police, the vehicle that used to ferry students of a private school met with an accident after the driver lost control of it while negotiating a curve.

395.title: Power supply to Metro, hospitals could be interrupted amid coal shortage: Delhi govt
395.article_body: Coal crisis in the national capital could hit essential services like Delhi Metro and hospitals, Delhi government said on Thursday. Coal in two of the five stations from where Delhi sources power would last only about one or two days, it added. "Delhi government...appealed to the Centre to provide an adequate supply of coal," Power Minister Satyendar Jain said.

396.title: Shahid Afridi is characterless, he conspired against me for being a Hindu: Kaneria
396.article_body: Ex-Pakistan leg-spinner Danish Kaneria claimed that Shahid Afridi conspired against him for being a Hindu. "I was always degraded by Afridi...He didn't want me to be in team...He'd go to other players and provoke them against me. I was performing well and he was jealous of me," Kaneria added. "He was a liar, manipulator...because he's a characterless person," Kaneria stated.

397.title: Fireball flying at 88,500 kmph spotted over US, causes loud boom
397.article_body: A fireball was spotted by residents of US' states of Arkansas, Louisiana and Mississippi. Several people reported hearing loud booms. As per NASA, the object, thought to be a piece of an asteroid, was about a foot in diameter and weighed 40 kg. "[It] moved southwest at a speed of 55,000 mph (over 88,500 kmph)," NASA further said.

398.title: Mumbai's Mulund station bags award for best cleaned suburban station of CR
398.article_body: Mumbai division's Mulund station bagged the award for being the cleanest suburban station on Central Railway and Asangaon stood second in the same category. At present, Mulund station handles around 1,000 local trains daily, experiencing an average daily footfall of around 2.5 lakh passengers. Mulund station has 54 twin dustbins for the segregation of waste at the source.

399.title: India responds after Pakistan PM Sharif terms PM Modi's visit to J&K as 'staged'
399.article_body: After Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif termed PM Narendra Modi's visit to J&K as "staged", External Affairs Ministry said, "Pakistan has no locus standi to comment on matters pertaining to the Union Territory." "We don't understand the word staged. It seems to indicate the visit did not take place and we are trying to show that it did," the ministry added.

400.title: Musk sells Tesla shares worth $4 bn, says no further sales planned
400.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has sold 4.4 million Tesla shares worth nearly $4 billion, filings showed. Commenting on the sale he said, "No further TSLA sales planned after today." Earlier this week, Tesla lost $126 billion in value amid investor concerns that Musk may sell shares to fund his $21 billion equity contribution to his $44-billion Twitter deal.

401.title: Woman in possession of swamp deer horns worth ₹1.5 cr held in Delhi
401.article_body: A 23-year-old woman possessing swamp deer horns worth around ₹1.5 crore was arrested from Delhi's Timarpur area, police said. The woman, a resident of Aruna Nagar, allegedly wanted to sell the horns, according to the police. The accused revealed that she had bought the horns from a resident of UP's Bahraich to sell them in Delhi, police added.

402.title: Gurugram to soon offer option of booking city bus seats using Uber
402.article_body: Gurugram Metropolitan City Bus Limited will soon start a special bus service where commuters can book their bus seats through the Uber app, making it a first-of-its-kind service in India. The special service will initially run on pilot basis for nine months on two routes. The buses will make three round trips each in the morning and evening.
